summary: Jake Esterline is mentioned in several CIA-related documents. One handwritten note from April 1967 includes his name alongside other individuals like Frank Droller, Helms, Knight, Rubottom, and Wieland, suggesting his involvement in CIA personnel and operations. He appears in a CIA personnel contact information list. He is also mentioned in depositions related to Cuban operations and anti-Castro activities, specifically in the context of William C. Sturbitts' testimony before the Rockefeller Commission. The documents suggest Esterline was a CIA employee involved in operations, possibly including those related to Cuba and anti-Castro efforts.
significance: Based on the documents, Jake Esterline appears to be a CIA employee involved in operations, potentially including those related to Cuba and anti-Castro efforts. His specific role in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated in these documents, but his association with CIA operations during the period is notable.
